I use form based login, everything works fine with action="j_security_check"

When I put a Servlet before j_security_check, and call it with 
action="Login", the servlet's dopost is not called (a debug message is not 
displayed), Netscape displays "The document contained no data..." after pressing 
the submit button. The tomcat console does not display an error, neither do the 
log files. (The servlet should save the username in the session.)

Thanks,
Juergen


The important parts of the servlet:

public void doPost(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response)
...
tSession.setAttribute("j_username",request.getParameter("j_username"));
...
RequestDispatcher tRD 
	            = 
getServletConfig().getServletContext().getRequestDispatcher("j_security_check");
tRD.forward(request, response);

text:
If a servlet is to be executed as "Login", then the servlet needs to be
mapped to "/Login" in web.xml.  Even with that mapping, you need
action="/<webapp>/Login" to invoke it.  I tried this in the "examples" webapp
in Tomcat 3.2.3 and Tomcat 3.3 and the LoginServlet was called.

I didn't try to "debug" the LoginServlet any further than verifying it is
called.  I have my doubts about getRequestDispatcher("j_security_check")
returning something other than null.
